channel.title: CyberNetSec - Security Operations
channel.description: Latest security operations threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: High-Severity Flaw in Mailpit Dev Tool Allows Email Interception
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-22689, has been discovered in Mailpit, a popular email testing tool for developers. The flaw is a Cross-Site WebSocket Hijacking (CSWSH) issue affecting all versions prior to 1.28.2. It allows a remote attacker to intercept sensitive data, including...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: YARA-X Update Helps Analysts Avoid Flawed Detection Rules
item.description:
Version 1.11.0 of YARA-X, a popular tool for malware analysis, has been released with a key enhancement aimed at improving the accuracy of detection rules. The update introduces 'hash function warnings,' a feature that alerts security analysts when they make common errors in hash string comparisons,...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cisco Patches Zero-Day Information Disclosure Flaw in ISE Platform
item.description:
Cisco has patched a high-severity zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2026-20029, in its Identity Services Engine (ISE) and ISE Passive Identity Connector (ISE-PIC). The flaw could allow an authenticated, remote administrator to read arbitrary files from the underlying system. The vulnerability is due to im...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: ownCloud Urges Users to Enable MFA as Credential Stuffing Attacks Surge
item.description:
In a proactive security move, the developers of the ownCloud file-sharing platform have issued a warning to all users, strongly advising them to enable multi-factor authentication (MFA). The advisory, released on January 7, 2026, is a direct response to recent reports of the 'Zestix' threat actor su...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Security Operations, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cognizant Sued in Class-Action Lawsuits After TriZetto Data Breach
item.description:
IT services giant Cognizant Technology Solutions is facing multiple class-action lawsuits in the U.S. following a significant data breach at its healthcare subsidiary, TriZetto Provider Solutions (TPS). The lawsuits, filed in New Jersey and Missouri, allege that Cognizant failed to adequately protec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Security Operations

item.title: Resecurity Turns Tables on Hackers, Claims Breach Was a Honeypot
item.description:
Cybersecurity firm Resecurity has publicly refuted claims of a major data breach made by a hacking group known as 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' (SLH). On January 3, 2026, the group announced on Telegram that it had compromised Resecurity's systems, stealing internal data and client information. Resecu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Year-End Report: Ransomware Industrializes into Cartels, Edge Devices Become Top Target
item.description:
A year-end analysis of the 2025 threat landscape highlights two dominant and transformative trends for enterprises. First, Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) has 'industrialized,' with threat groups operating like sophisticated cartels and employing 'Extortion 2.0' tactics that involve both data encrypt...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Security Operations

item.title: CISA Warns of Code Execution Flaw in WatchGuard Fireware OS
item.description:
On December 26, 2025, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) issued an alert for a vulnerability in WatchGuard's Fireware OS. The flaw could potentially allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected network security appliance. Specific details such as the CVE i...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Australian Health Audit Finds Clinicians Routinely Bypass Security Controls
item.description:
An audit of the New South Wales (NSW) healthcare system in Australia has revealed that clinicians are routinely bypassing critical cybersecurity controls, such as password sharing and using personal devices, to save time in high-pressure environments. This widespread "normalisation of non-compliance...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Security Operations, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Google Investigates Malicious Code Found in Search Result Infrastructure
item.description:
Google has launched an urgent investigation after cybersecurity analysts discovered anomalous, encrypted code snippets and obfuscated JavaScript embedded within its core search result payloads on December 17, 2025. The malicious code appears designed to exploit browser sandboxing vulnerabilities, wh...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Security Operations
